text: Heinrich Rohrer (6 June 1933 - 16 May 2013) was a Swiss physicist. He shared half of the 1986 Nobel Prize in Physics with Gerd Binnig for the design of the scanning tunneling microscope (STM). (The other half of the Prize was awarded to Ernst Ruska.) Rohrer was born on 6 June 1933 in Buchs, St. Gallen, Switzerland. He was raised in ZÃ¼rich, Switzerland. Rohrer studied at Swiss Federal Institute of Technology. He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1991. He was never married.
